"My Circle is the app that makes you join into a group of people who want to visit at a specific day the same place
column6: as Museums – Concerts – Theatre – Cinema etc. The aim is to prevent crowding at the box office and individual tickets.

column1: According to a quick research
column2: studying the Italian theme parks network
column3: (from Gardaland to the Acquario di Genova) we can easily notice that the individual tickets average price is 28€
column4: instead groups average price is 21€. That is 25% discount off the single ticket sale price (estimate based on 6 theme parks).

column1: All Members join the Group with their own credit card in order to guarantee the prospective payment. The amount will be blocked on the credit card
column2: and the transaction will come to pass when the Group reaches the appropriate number of members; then all the members will receive their tickets by e-mail.

column1: Groups allow people to save money and are a good way for companies to make purchases easier. Our strong point is an organized community looking for money-saving chance
column2: using the same service with an average reduction of 25%
column3: and a maximum of 35%. The Community
column4: thanks to various My Circle offers
column5: will be glad to use the app whenever is possible
column6: for a single day visit as well as for a longer visit. The point is “together we can save money” ! The point of strength is the app usability and the chance to join a group to save money.

column1: Business Model

Our business model is composed of subscription model for parents/preschool teachers and ordering prints/merchandising related to the child. Recently Remini successfully tested these models. Targeted marketing is an optional model that will be evaluated at a later stage.
Current State
Remini has a working product in smartphones (ios
column2: android) and the web
column3: had a successful pilot in the Israeli market
column4: with hundreds of daily active preschools and more than 30
column5: 000 Users. The amount of material uploaded per active user is more than twice in comparison to Facebook. Remini started expending internationally with endorsements  from several preschool organizations including ECE-RJ

column1: Remini has raised investment from Heli Bennun and Zohar Zisapel.

column22: 2013 Brighten CEO Austin Kevitch received a Facebook message that read
column23: “Oliver has passed away in a tragic climbing accident”. Friends began posting on Oliver’s Facebook wall
column24: showing their appreciation for the positive impact he had made on their lives. Inspired
column27: and a pack of sticky notes. He then left this compliment box on a table outside his dorm – by the end of the box was overflowing with anonymous notes. It Brightened someone’s day each time they received an anonymous note
column28: and it was even more fun to write them. We want to extend that feeling to as many people as possible.

column1: Brighten gives you the superpower of anonymity
column2: and lets you use it for something good. Make someone's day by writing nice things to your friends
column4: and colleagues. Isn't it about time we use an app based on kindness? Studies in human psychology show that one of the most important controls of our behavior are the established norms within any given community. Brighten is the first anonymous online community based on positivity
column6: and kindness. Everyone has their own 'home feed' to see all the nice things their friends are saying to each other. Creative ways to use Brighten: give anonymous compliments
column10: express feelings. We are also building our mobile SaaS enterprise version for positive reinforcement and constructive criticism within the workplace. "	"https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/brighten-positive-social-network/id763284013?mt=8

column1: I’m born and raised Nepal
column2: where the caste system still exists. While at school a girl named Bandana
column4: fell in love. Bandana and I are from different castes
column5: which meant that our relationship was resolutely forbidden by our culture and our families.

column1: So
column2: we put our heads together and concocted a plan: to convince our parents to allow us to attend university overseas

column1: The plan worked
column2: but I had no financial support and had to work two jobs to pay the exorbitant international student fees. I'm proud of the fact that I managed to complete my degree with distinction.

"Karma has two main points of difference. The first is that it is focussed on a very specific
column3: currently untapped niche: reviews about people. And the second is
column4: for the first time on a social platform
column5: the information about a person will not be created or vetted by that individual.

column1: We provide solutions these 4 problems:
1.) Learning about a person. We currently have the following main options: Google
column2: Facebook
column5: or asking a mutual connection. With enough digging we may gather the data we need
column6: but none of these solutions provide a simple snapshot of a person's reputation.

column1: 2.) Writing a positive review. We can thank someone publicly by tagging them in a Facebook post (just two days after writing this sentence
column2: Facebook released their “Say Thanks” feature). This is a nice gesture
column3: but as it is not public or searchable information
column4: it has limited utility to the person being thanked.

column1: 3.) Writing a negative review. When someone has harmed us
column2: we may wish to warn others. A friend of mine recently let his house out while he was overseas. When he returned he found that the tenants had left his home in a state of disrepair. My friends would liked to have warned others against engaging with the these people
column3: but there is currently no way for him to do so.

column1: 4.) Leveraging your reputation. People leverage their reputations through word of mouth within a specific community. But what happens if we relocate to a different city or country

"5S will take off-the-shelf hardware and pair it with custom software to solve limitations in current solutions or identify unmet market segments. Because of the extensive talents of the founders and advisory board members we do not commit ourselves to any one industry or silo of interest. We look for fun problems to solve and search globally for tools that when combined with IP provide the solutions.

column1: The founders and advisors bring such a wide range of experience that unique solutions are manifested readily. Many problems are identified and solved but only those that can be satisfactorily monetized are pursued. The team has an extensive network of experts who can identify or provide the aggregation tools required.

For our first project we have created a new sports fantasy site that focuses an being a fan of sports instead of an analyzer of individual players. Our second project involves teen driving and cell phone use. Our third project is optimizing real-time visualization of business intelligence.

5S is attempting to capture the dynamics of Thomas Edison's original laboratory. When he found interesting problems he led his team to explore a myriad of potential solutions but only bringing to market those that produced significant income. However he was inventor of products that created industries and monopolies; 5S is an innovator in identifying the true desires of the market segment that is underserved. column5: your phone died? How often were you in the middle of an important conversation with a boss

column1: Our phones often die at the most inopportune places at the most inconvenient times
column2: but there are no great alternatives for consumers to turn to today.

column1: There are wired chargers
column2: inductive charging pads
column4: and external battery packs. Inductive charging pads are thin matt-like objects that charge an electronic device only when placed directly on the pad. Crowd solution products being developed aim to be similar to WiFi but for power within a small office or room. Lastly
column5: external battery packs are portable high capacity batteries.

column1: Inductive charging pads and crowd solution products offer more power at inconvenient times
column2: but not necessarily inopportune places because their systems rely on an outlet to function. Thus
column3: these products are implemented in places where we normally still have access to power. This almost makes 'wireless charging' seem like an oxymoron since the products require a wire to use. Meanwhile
column4: external battery packs are almost the opposite. External battery packs offer consumers more power at inopportune places or areas where consumers don't have readily access to power
column5: but not necessarily inconvenient times. This is because the physical connection between the external battery pack and the electronic device can be cumbersome while on the move or we simply forget the battery state of our device due to multitasking.

column1: Our product called the MotherBox is the first device that can babysit your phone for you! It has a rechargeable battery so it can offer additional power in a similar fashion to external battery packs
column2: and it also has the ability to provide wireless power-on-demand! The MotherBox can sense the battery level of your device
column4: and wirelessly charge your device during use. For example
column5: the next time you're in the middle of that important conversation and your battery drops from 10% to 5% the MotherBox can sense that change and begin seamlessly charging it. The user can then customize his or her experience via the mobile application."	We wirelessly charge electronic devices as they move freely at the moments and places you need them most.	"API

column15: as they move freely. Our systems leverage resonant inductive technology
column16: a highly efficient and safe wireless power transfer medium
column17: in unique ways that allow us to overcome many challenges facing today's wireless charging systems.

column1: Although resonant inductive technology allows slight misalignment of coils
column2: it is still sensitive to the angular alignment between them. If the angle between your device and the wireless charging product is misaligned
column3: your device may not charge well or at all. Furthermore
column4: resonant inductive technology has difficulty charging multiple devices simultaneously if the transmitter coil isn't much larger than the receiving coil. Because few people would like to wrap a coil around their house and pay an electric bill equivalent to operating a power plant

column1: With our first product called the MotherBox
column2: we solve these major limitations. The MotherBox is a 4” x 4” portable wireless charging platform that is capable of charging devices within 1½’ to 2’ radius. With our unique coil geometry
column3: the MotherBox is capable of enduring great coil misalignment
column5: we prevent magnetic distortion from multiple resonating receivers. For the first time
column6: you can charge your phone as you walk to class
column8: or kick back at your desk! "	www.yanktech.net 	"By going through the program

column42: we can conduct real-time temperature monitoring and create recommended charging periods to prevent overheating and overcharging of users' devices. The recommended charging periods is very important because many users unintentionally diminish the useful battery life of their devices by charging them overnight. Zet Universe is a visual dashboard that integrates project information for PMs struggling with too many projects 	"Project Managers have to be in control of their projects; existing software stores information in separate silos
column34: so projects live only in PMs’ heads. Forgetting things leads to cascade failures within PMs’ organizations. To avoid that
column35: PMs spend about 4 hours a day to get the most current project status
column36: but failures still happen. Zet Universe allows PMs to keep track of their project information.

column1: Zet Universe is in many ways unique as it allows customers to continue using services they use instead of switching to another project management solution (which is usually offered in these cases). Zet Universe by its nature is similar to Google as smart indexer that builds knowledge graph of users' projects
column2: and similar to Palantir Workspace as it allows users to connect and visualize data sources to organize data by projects.

column1: From user perspective
column2: Zet Universe is a visual dashboard. It shows all project information from various sources in one place. Zet Universe provides a combination of intuitive visual metaphor
column3: familiar manually and automatically extracted IF-THIS-THAN-THAT (IFTTT-like) rules
column4: and semantic extraction to define project information boundaries. Those boundaries are used to automatically classify incoming information by user's projects.

"The Stated Home will address three issues with the current furniture shopping environment: consumer frustration from so many choices

column1: Shopping for furniture is often overwhelming since existing furniture stores offer hundreds of different options per category of good (ie sofas). The Stated Home will offer a curated selection of furniture in versatile styles from only the best manufacturers. There will be written and video content to highlight the benefits of our offerings as well as tutorials on how to figure out the best style and fabric for the customer.

Consumers don’t know what to consider when looking for comfortable furniture and comfort is impossible to determine when shopping online. We will create a comfort rating system and a series of written and video tutorials to explain what to think about when determining if a piece of furniture will be comfortable. In addition
column2: individual furniture styles will have videos of comfort “testers” sitting on and talking about how the piece feels to further eliminate this barrier to online furniture shopping.

column1: There is no centralized source for consumers to find stylish
column2: high- quality American-made household goods. I will identify American manufacturers that offer on-trend furniture styles.

column11: 000. These methods take editing and production skills and take a lot of time. Also
column12: this process doesn't necessarily include people outside of the production team. Granvu is a social media app that allows an older loved one to answer one question at a time through a tablet making the software a self editor. The app also encourages friends and family to ask questions and start a dialogue with older loved ones. The system has built-in questions that a user can answer or ask and also allows the users to enter their own questions. Overall
column13: Granvu is an easy way to answer life's most important questions and save them for future generations.

"	Lean Media uses offline data analytics & IP geo-location to help advertisers reach online audiences with greater precision & specificity. 	Lean Media maps physical addresses to IP addresses to programmatically deliver online banner ads to advertisers’ target audiences directly at the household or business level. This unique approach to addressable online display advertising focuses on using offline demographic and psychographic attributes to target individuals and households on all major ad networks and exchanges and across devices vs. relying only on third-party cookies and past online behavior to target devices. The result is more relevance for the viewer and increased ROAS (Return on Advertising Spend) for the advertiser. 	www.lean.media 	"Lean Media hopes to accelerate our ability to establish a sustainable and scalable woman-owned technology business based in St. Louis. column4: Google "	 	StickyPop is a geo-network where users create virtual spots at a location and post content available only to others physically at that spot. 	"StickyPop is a social platform where users can create and name virtual news feeds ""Spots"" at their current location.  The trick is that only users whom are physically at that ""Spot"" can see and comment on the content posted to the spot (Pics
column5: videos and text). This makes the posted content visibly limited by the Spot's geographical location (i.e. A user can only create
column7: post and comment if they are physically there).

column1: Most platforms ""push"" posted content out to anyone that is a user of the platform.  StickyPop ""narrows"" and limits visibility of posted content to a specific location.  Making StickyPop a social platform that is exclusive location.  Our goal is to provide a completely new system that people will use to better connect and share with others in their direct environment.
For example
column2: imagine you are a college student out with your friends at a local bar/club/venue. There is currently no way for you to virtually connect with others at that venue.  You open StickyPop and immediately see what other people at that venue (or who have been there before) have posted
column3: while remaining completely invisible to others until you post to that Spot.

column1: StickyPop is the first system to be legitimate by telemetry
column2: relevant by location and designed to allow users to ""Opt-in"" to the experience.  "	"website: http://stickypopapp.appsites.com

column5: and subjective emotional input to generate a stress profile for the user.

column1: If a user gets fed up with his boss at work and his stress levels increase
column2: the DataDog app will send his phone a notification. Not only will the notification remind him of his emotional state
column3: it will provide ways for the user to reduce stress. If the user doesn't  engage with DataDog  in that moment
column4: he can address the notification any time afterward. Later
column5: when the user is home or with his therapist
column6: he can sign into the DataDog web portal and view when and where his stress levels were increased. He can then schedule exercises and set goals for the future.

column1: The set of tools that DataDog app and web portal provides allows users to identify personal triggers and establish helpful stress management strategies with or without a therapist. Therapy options include cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT)
column2: a clinically validated tool which challenges the user to dispute their anxiety-producing beliefs. The exercises also include mindfulness based stress reduction another validated stress relief tools.

column34: but that money can come with an unwelcome side effect: sizable tax liabilities. With trillions of dollars invested in tax-deferred asset accounts like IRAs and 401(k)s
column35: many retirees are facing large tax bills when they reach the withdrawal phase of their investment timeline. These looming tax bills have been characterized as a ""time bomb"" for retirees
column36: but SPRY Analytics views it as an opportunity to offer a solution combining professional expertise and knowledge of retirement planning and a proprietary software service that seeks to optimize a strategic withdrawal plan to minimize taxes.

column1: SPRY Analytics was formed with the idea that software can be designed to lower the costs of professional expertise and time for individuals who will benefit from a tax-optimized withdrawal strategy before and during retirement. The software reduces the cost and simplifies the process for professionals who want to provide the service to clients. Such analyses are already possible when performed by qualified professionals dedicating significant hours to the process
column2: but the costs of such analyses can reduce or eclipse the benefits they uncover. SPRY's software employs proprietary algorithms to deliver straightforward account withdrawal strategies designed to minimize taxes
column3: and requires only a few minutes to input clients' personal and account information. "	"Demo screencast: http://spryanalytics.com/demo/

column8: and offers them to a much broader market than previously possible. "	"Most financial advisors and accountants use software to help manage client accounts that include features that take into account the effect of taxes on individual investment plans. What sets SPRY's software apart is its ability to run an optimization algorithm on a client's current financial scenario that recommends a strategic withdrawal path to minimize taxes over an entire investment horizon.

"iDoFund is a crowd-funding web app where the brides
column25: grooms and their guests can raise money for their wedding without being assessed credit card fees.  Additionally
column26: key vendor partners and a fixed pricing model gives iDoFund an competitive advantage over other solutions. Vendor partners pay for credit card processing and no other fees.  There is a minimal crowd funding layout with video
column29: and bride and groom blog updates.  It will be the ""flexible"" campaign type where you can keep whatever is funded to you.  iDoFund uses the stretch goals concept with one vendor per stretch goal.  In this way
column30: only one vendor is being funded at a time. When Vendor A is fully funded
column31: then Vendor B is funded and so-on.  This allows the Bride and Grooms to prioritize their vendors
column32: and only one vendor will be partially funded at any point in time.  Money is collected by iDoFund and paid directly to the vendors via bank transfer (via Stripe).  With this money-flow
column33: it makes the monetary gifts more meaningful. The Bride and Groom will receive a paper gift-certificate to use with the Vendor for their wedding.  Additionally
column34: this money-flow commits the brides to the vendor partners and allows partners to offer promotional pricing and offers.    Instead of large
column35: uncapped percentage fees and credit card fees that are accessed by our competitors
column36: iDoFund charges $39 per vendor out of funds raised. "	No demo or website is live at the moment.  The URL is http;//ido.fund 	"Through Capital Innovators

"MeterGenius is a free website and mobile app that provides tools and incentives for homeowners to engage with and lower their electricity usage. MeterGenius gives homeowners with smart meters the ability to track electricity consumption at a granular level
column22: create reminders to help them change their behavior
column24: set goals and track their progress
column26: and earn points that can be redeemed for bill credits.

column1: Our focus on user engagement not only sets us apart from competitors
column2: but has allowed us to deliver superior results - increasing retention by 27%! The 3 pillars of our user engagement strategy work together to strengthen the impact of each other. First
column3: we create user-specific suggestions to help our users become more energy efficient. These suggestions come from our analysis of their smart meter data
column4: as well as their responses to profile questions about their home
column6: and motivations. Our second pillar is the tools that allow our users to act upon the suggestions we make. For example
column7: we currently integrate with Emerson's Sensi
column8: so our users can control their thermostat from our app
column9: or sign up for programs that allow MeterGenius to control their thermostat more efficiently. Finally
column10: the thing that ties all of this together is our rewards program. We provide points for reducing electricity and using energy during low cost times. These points can be redeemed for energy efficient appliances. "	"https://metergenius.com/

column8: MeterGenius is focused on engaging electricity customers in order to increase retention and reduce energy usage.  Our biggest differentiator is our rewards program
column9: which motivates users to lower their energy usage and use electricity when costs are lowest for electricity suppliers.  Every electricity provider faces variable costs per kWh throughout the day
column10: but no program exists that rewards users for using electricity more during off-peak hours and less during peak hours. "	"There are multiple energy analytics companies
column15: however they’re all designed to lower electricity bills by 2-3% by simply comparing users to their neighbors.  MeterGenius is the only solution for competitive electricity suppliers that is designed to increase customer retention by increasing engagement.  None of these companies have a rewards program. "	MeterGenius generates revenue by licensing our software to retail electricity suppliers on a price per customer basis.  We have a flat fee for all customers and additional fees for customers that create an account or opt into our smart thermostat program.  Our second source of revenue comes from selling smart appliances to our users.  These appliances are integrated with the MeterGenius app and are usually purchased by the electricity suppliers and then given to their customers for free.  	"We sell to marketing decision makers of retail electricity providers. Most of our conversations have resulted from our large network of energy industry veterans. Some potential clients have even reached out to us
column16: as they have heard about MeterGenius through various press hits. We intend to position MeterGenius as an expert in customer engagement by presenting at various industry forums. Our CEO has been invited to speak at industry events

column11: one life is lost every two hours and an economic loss of approximately $30MM is incurred due to distracted driving. column12: while not hindering the benefits of the mobile phone.

column1: We successfully developed a prototype utilizing readily available hardware that is currently used for different applications in different sectors. By appropriately modifying
column2: we were able to tailor the hardware to reuse for this specific application. The complete solution includes an RF transmitter that communicates with our app on the phone. column4: emergency calls) various functions . It provides the ability to reconfigure the non-safe (driver's seat) and safe areas within the car. column15: cutting freight costs and saving time. "	"With the advancement of new technology
column18: the value of a broker for both the carrier and the shipper has been greatly reduced
column19: but brokers are still widely used.   FreightGrid has built a solution that empowers shippers to take their freight management in-house and eliminate the need to use a broker.  By charging a low
column20: flat monthly rate and offering a rich feature set that takes the difficulty out of trying to manage all the different facets of sending and receiving LTL freight and provides shippers everything they need to negotiate directly with carriers
column21: FG is positioned to change the way small to midsize manufacturers send LTL freight.  FG manages all of a user's customer and freight data
column22: and gets smarter the more it is used.  Features: Shipping includes pulling rates from multiple carriers onto one screen
column23: automating and aggregating email rate requests
column25: and sending notices to the carrier and consignee.  The tracking functionality allows users to manage both their inbound and outbound shipments and easily communicate with customers and suppliers.  FG also provides a wealth of reporting and analytics which are essential for negotiating good rates on an ongoing basis.  FG is also seeing a prime opportunity to white-label our software and offer it to carriers.  FG is currently working on implementing a solution with St. Louis based LTL carrier CRH Transport. "Unlike other freelance exchanges that use a proposal system
column23: our “Talent Recommendation Engine” uses both quantitative and qualitative data to match clients with their four most compatible provider options. By aligning client and provider incentives through a merit based system that establishes price integrity
column24: we not only help our clients find the best provider on our site
column25: but offer a class of freelancer far superior to what can be found on today’s exchanges.

column1: The following features differentiate our exchange from others:
Invitation-Only Matching - Most exchanges employ an open job proposal process that results in a deluge of job proposals received. Our Engine suggests the four best providers for a particular job
column2: dramatically reducing the risk of making the wrong hire.

column1: High-Quality Standards - Today’s exchanges are open to any provider
column2: which means quality standards suffer. Our Engine contains three levels of provider quality control.

column1: Meritocratic Tier Structure - Our provider tier structure validates the prices providers can charge for their services and creates a clear path to higher earnings potential. For clients
column2: they provide optionality at a range of prices.

column1: Provider Focus - We are creating an egalitarian platform where both sides are given the tools to make outsourcing work easier.
Data-Driven Approach - We embrace big data by capturing on-site metrics such as response rates
